composition.Programmer 1: Test whether the website can be accessed through local port 5000. In this test, you only need to test whether the login page of the website can be accessed through the local 5000 port.
composition.Programmer 2: Test whether the first page of the website is the login page and whether it can log in correctly based on the example data provided in the Task.
composition.Programmer 3:
Test the elements and integrity of all pages, ensuring that each page contains the required elements as specified in the requirements document. This includes 
- Login Page  Check for the presence of login-form, username input, password input, login-button, register-button, and login-error div.
- Register Page  Check for the presence of register-form, username input, password input, and register-button.
- Dashboard Page  Check for the presence of dashboard-header, expense-summary div, add-expense-button, view-expense-button, add-income-button, report-button, and logout-button.
- Add Expense Page  Check for the presence of add-expense-form, expense-name input, expense-amount input, expense-date input, expense-category dropdown, and submit-expense-button.
- Add Income Page  Check for the presence of add-income-form, income-amount input, income-date input, income-category dropdown, and submit-income-button.
- View Expenses Page  Check for the presence of expense-list table and delete-expense-button.
- Reports Page  Check for the presence of report-select dropdown, generate-report-button, and report-output div.
